poem:
Title: "Electronic Emissaries"

In silence, no voice - 
only the tap-tap morse of text,
a modern message tossed to the wind.
Pictures soulless, through screen's flicker,
and their echo prickles up spines.
A contract unravelled, like old twine 
in the proof of transmission. 
This new world's whisper, 
misaligned in intention,
between cable kings and humble hostesses,
an injustice etched in electric pulsation.
